slides.title: Announcing .NET 10
bullets: Faster, more elegant, and extensible code with C# 14
Industry leading performance with improvements to help apps launch quicker, run smoother, and scale effortlessly
Supercharged SDK and libraries let you build more secure and future-ready apps with confidence
Modern features for web, cloud, mobile, and cross-platform development designed for today and tomorrow's workloads
Long-Term Support (LTS) release

slides.title: Visual Studio 2026
bullets: Optimized for .NET 10 and C++, and ready to grow with you with monthly feature updates
Instant startup with solutions loading up to 50% faster and a quicker build, edit, debug cycle even on massive codebases
Modern design with Fluent UI makes it lighter and easier to navigate and stay focused on code, not the tool
AI that works for you with new GitHub Copilot capabilities for profiling, testing, and modernization

sections.title: Runtime
sections.content: Performance improvements, Just-In-Time (JIT) compiler optimizations, improved Garbage Collector (GC), AVX10.2 support for cutting-edge Intel silicon

sections.title: .NET SDK
sections.content: File-based apps with publish support & native AOT, natively create container images, Microsoft.Testing.Platform support in dotnet test, tab-completion scripts for popular shells

sections.title: .NET Libraries
sections.content: MEAI enhancements, first-class support for MCP, new APIs in cryptography, globalization, numerics, serialization, collections, diagnostics, new JSON serialization options, networking enhancements

sections.title: Security
sections.content: Security & cryptography enhancements, including Windows Cryptography API: Next Generation (CNG) support for Post-quantum Cryptography (PQC)

sections.title: ASP.NET Core
sections.content: Simple security with WebAuthN & passkeys, validation for Minimal APIs, OpenAPI 3.1, enhanced app observability & diagnostics, smarter memory management, and improved JSON Patch handling

sections.title: Blazor
sections.content: Improved scalability & reliability with declarative state persistence, complex form validation, QuickGrid enhancements, WebAssembly diagnostics, streamlined JavaScript interop, automated browser testing

sections.title: .NET MAUI
sections.content: Editing, build & runtime performance, Aspire integration, many control enhancements and quality improvements, support for latest platform versions including Xcode 26, Android API 35 & 36

sections.title: EF Core
sections.content: LINQ enhancements, performance optimizations, improved support for Azure Cosmos DB, and named query filters

slides.title: C# 14
bullets: Null-conditional assignment
`field` backed properties
Extension members
Modifiers on simple lambda parameters
`nameof` supports unbound generic types
Implicit conversions for `Span<T>` and `ReadOnlySpan<T>`
Partial events and constructors
User defined compound assignment operators
slides.imageAlt: C# 14 code examples showing field keyword and other features

slides.title: Microsoft Agent Framework
bullets: Unified foundation for building AI agents and multi-agent workflows
Interactive developer UI for agent development, testing, and debugging workflows
Built on open standards for interoperability and flexibility
Community-driven, open-source and extensible by design
slides.imageAlt: Microsoft Agent Framework developer UI showing multi-agent content creation workflow with Writer, Reviewer, and Editor agents

slides.title: Model Context Protocol (MCP)
slides.description: MCP Clients call tools, request resources, and get prompts. MCP Servers expose tools, resources, and prompts. Examples include Visual Studio Code, Claude, GitHub on the client side, and custom MCP servers built with C# using the MCP C# SDK on the server side.
slides.imageAlt: Model Context Protocol architecture diagram showing MCP Clients and MCP Servers with bidirectional communication

slides.title: An agent enhanced by MCP
slides.description: Architecture diagram showing how an agent processes input from system events, user messages, and agent messages through an LLM with instructions and tools, then outputs agent messages and tool results. The agent connects to a custom MCP server built with the MCP C# SDK.
slides.imageAlt: Agent architecture diagram showing input processing through LLM and connection to MCP server

slides.title: MCP C# SDK
bullets: Full support for current MCP spec
Tools, resources, prompts
Elicitation, sampling
Stdio and HTTP transports
Widely used across Microsoft
More features accepted and coming soon

slides.title: Aspire

sections.title: Aspire AppHost + CLI
sections.content: Define your stack in **code** — type-safe, readable, and **debuggable**. Aspire runs it all locally, then shifts to **real cloud services.**

sections.title: Aspire Integrations
sections.content: Plug in **any code or service**, whether it's local or remote. Aspire brings **common patterns** – but can model **anything**.

sections.title: Aspire Dashboard
sections.content: See your **entire stack** running in one place – all your **logs**, **endpoints**, **environment** variables, even full **OpenTelemetry**.

slides.imageAlt: Aspire architecture diagram showing connected services

slides.title: Aspire 13.0
bullets: Unified infrastructure across .NET, JavaScript, and Python with debugging, container-deployment, auto-generated Dockerfiles
Modern development experience with CLI enhancements, single-file AppHost support, and quicker onboarding
Seamless build & deployment, built in static file site support, and robust deploy parallelization
Enterprise-ready infrastructure & services with flexible connection strings and certificate trust across languages and containers
slides.imageAlt: Aspire Dashboard showing distributed trace details

slides.title: ASP.NET Core 10
bullets: Blazor WebAssembly preloading for faster startup
Automatic memory pool eviction for high throughput
First-class OpenAPI 3.1 support for minimal APIs
Identity management updates with Passkeys (FIDO2) support
New `RedirectHttpResult.IsLocalUrl` helper for security
slides.imageAlt: ASP.NET Core 10 web development abstract visualization

slides.title: .NET 10 Libraries
bullets: New `FindUtf8` method in `PemEncoding` for direct UTF-8 processing
Post-quantum cryptography (PQC) support with ML-KEM, ML-DSA, and SLH-DSA
`ISOWeek` support for `DateOnly` type
`WebSocketStream` for simplified WebSocket scenarios
TLS 1.3 support for macOS client

slides.title: .NET 10 SDK & Tooling
bullets: Platform-specific .NET tools with multi-RID support
One-shot tool execution with `dotnet tool exec`
Native shell tab-completion scripts for bash, zsh, fish, etc.
File-based apps with publish support and native AOT
`dotnet test` native support for Microsoft.Testing.Platform
